name: Vendor Security Normalizer (JSON)
samplePrompt: Normalize each vendor's security response to a standard JSON schema. For each control, output: control_id (e.g., 'ENC-AT-REST'), summary (1–2 lines), evidence (links or doc names), risk_level (low|medium|high), gaps (array of missing info), confidence (0–1). Output pure JSON array only, no prose.

chunks.title: Vendor A Responses (unstructured)
chunks.body: Encryption at rest: We use AES-256 on all RDS volumes; keys in KMS, rotation annually.\nIncident response: We have a 24/7 on-call rotation; we test IR twice per year; last incident: none in 12 months.\nAccess reviews: Managers review quarterly in our IAM dashboard; tickets in Jira.

chunks.title: Vendor B Responses (unstructured)
chunks.body: Data at rest is encrypted, but we don't have details handy. Keys are 'managed by our cloud'.\nIR: On-call engineers; we had a phishing incident last spring; we resolved it in under 24h.\nAccess reviews: Annual audit; manual spreadsheet.

chunks.title: Vendor C Responses (unstructured)
chunks.body: At-rest encryption: KMS-managed keys, rotation every 90 days; SSE-S3 for object storage.\nIR: We maintain a formal plan aligned to NIST; postmortems documented.\nAccess: RBAC with SSO; reviews biannually; approvals stored in GRC.
